member.summary: De-optimize a method.
member.param: The problem containing the method to de-optimize.
member.remarks: If the given method is new (has not already been de-optimized), then we forward the request to Production Breakpoints and set the ref-count to 1. Otherwise, we just increment the ref count.

member.summary: Re-optimize a method by undoing the effects of de-optimization.
member.param: The problem containing the method to re-optimize.
member.remarks: This decrements the de-optimization ref count on the given problem. If the count gets to zero, then we forward the request to Production Breakpoints.
member.exception: The given method is not de-optimized.

member.name: T:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.SnapshotCollector.EmittedMethod
member.summary: A wrapper around a dynamically-generated method -- generated via System.Reflection.Emit. These are most often encountered when an exception is thrown from a compiled expression (System.Linq.Expressions), often used in Entity Framework code. The primary purpose of this class is to implement equality between different compilations of the same expression.

member.summary: The dynamic method wrapped by this object.

member.summary: A hash-code based on the generated IL of the dynamic method body.

member.summary: Constructs an instance of .
member.param: An RTDynamicMethod that represents a dynamic method.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.SnapshotCollector.EmittedMethod.CreateFromTargetSite(System.Reflection.MethodBase)
member.summary: If the given method is dynamic (e.g. compiled from an expression tree), then wrap it in an instance so that we can compare the IL stream with identical dynamic instances.
member.param: The target site (throwing method) of an exception.
member.returns: If represents an emitted, dynamic method, then a instance which will compare equal with other dynamic methods generated from the same expression. If is not a dynamic method, or something goes wrong, then null is returned.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.SnapshotCollector.EmittedMethod.Equals(System.Object)
member.summary: Overridden equality. Compares two objects and, if the other is an instance, uses the method.
member.returns: true if the two objects should compare equal.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.SnapshotCollector.EmittedMethod.Equals(Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.SnapshotCollector.EmittedMethod)
member.summary: Compare two instances. Uses the IL hash as the identity.
member.returns: true if the two methods have the same IL.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.SnapshotCollector.EmittedMethod.GetHashCode
member.summary: Overridden hash code implementation. Uses the IL hash as the identity.
member.returns: A hash-code based on the generated IL of the dynamic method.

member.summary: https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/desktop/aa366770(v=vs.85).aspx

member.name: F:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.SnapshotCollector.EnvironmentMemoryHelper.NativeMethods.MEMORYSTATUSEX.dwLength
member.summary: The size of the structure, in bytes. You must set this member before calling GlobalMemoryStatusEx.

member.name: F:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.SnapshotCollector.EnvironmentMemoryHelper.NativeMethods.MEMORYSTATUSEX.dwMemoryLoad
member.summary: A number between 0 and 100 that specifies the approximate percentage of physical memory that is in use (0 indicates no memory use and 100 indicates full memory use).

member.name: F:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.SnapshotCollector.EnvironmentMemoryHelper.NativeMethods.MEMORYSTATUSEX.ullTotalPhys
member.summary: The amount of actual physical memory, in bytes.

member.name: F:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.SnapshotCollector.EnvironmentMemoryHelper.NativeMethods.MEMORYSTATUSEX.ullAvailPhys
member.summary: The amount of physical memory currently available, in bytes. This is the amount of physical memory that can be immediately reused without having to write its contents to disk first. It is the sum of the size of the standby, free, and zero lists.

member.name: F:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.SnapshotCollector.EnvironmentMemoryHelper.NativeMethods.MEMORYSTATUSEX.ullTotalPageFile
member.summary: The current committed memory limit for the system or the current process, whichever is smaller, in bytes. To get the system-wide committed memory limit, call GetPerformanceInfo.

member.name: F:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.SnapshotCollector.EnvironmentMemoryHelper.NativeMethods.MEMORYSTATUSEX.ullAvailPageFile
member.summary: The maximum amount of memory the current process can commit, in bytes. This value is equal to or smaller than the system-wide available commit value. To calculate the system-wide available commit value, call GetPerformanceInfo and subtract the value of CommitTotal from the value of CommitLimit.

member.name: F:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.SnapshotCollector.EnvironmentMemoryHelper.NativeMethods.MEMORYSTATUSEX.ullTotalVirtual
member.summary: The size of the user-mode portion of the virtual address space of the calling process, in bytes. This value depends on the type of process, the type of processor, and the configuration of the operating system. For example, this value is approximately 2 GB for most 32-bit processes on an x86 processor and approximately 3 GB for 32-bit processes that are large address aware running on a system with 4-gigabyte tuning enabled.

member.name: F:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.SnapshotCollector.EnvironmentMemoryHelper.NativeMethods.MEMORYSTATUSEX.ullAvailVirtual
member.summary: The amount of unreserved and uncommitted memory currently in the user-mode portion of the virtual address space of the calling process, in bytes.

member.name: F:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.SnapshotCollector.EnvironmentMemoryHelper.NativeMethods.MEMORYSTATUSEX.ullAvailExtendedVirtual
member.summary: Reserved. This value is always 0.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.SnapshotCollector.Interop.Request.DisposeNative
member.summary: Derived classes should dispose of native resources here. The base implementation does nothing, so there's no need to call it. There are two cases when it will be called: 1) The normal case is when is called and is false. 2) When the finalizer runs (because has not been called). This is usually an error case, but it gives us a chance to free critical native resources.

member.name: T:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.SnapshotCollector.SnapshotCollectorConfiguration
member.summary: Configuration options for the . These options are typically set in the ApplicationInsights.config file.

member.name: E:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.SnapshotCollector.SnapshotCollectorConfiguration.PropertyChanged
member.summary: Event fired when one of the properties has been changed.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.SnapshotCollector.SnapshotCollectorConfiguration.IsEnabled
member.summary: Whether snapshot collection is enabled. Default value: true.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.SnapshotCollector.SnapshotCollectorConfiguration.IsEnabledInDeveloperMode
member.summary: Whether snapshot collection is enabled in developer mode. See . Default value: false.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.SnapshotCollector.SnapshotCollectorConfiguration.ThresholdForSnapshotting
member.summary: How many times we need to see an exception before we ask for snapshots. Default value: 1.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.SnapshotCollector.SnapshotCollectorConfiguration.MaximumSnapshotsRequired
member.summary: The maximum number of snapshots we collect for a single problem. A problem may be thought of as an individual throw statement in your application. Once the number of snapshots collected for a problem reaches this value, no more snapshots will be collected for that problem until problem counters are reset (see ) and the is reached again. Default value: 3. Valid range: 1 to 999.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.SnapshotCollector.SnapshotCollectorConfiguration.MaximumCollectionPlanSize
member.summary: The maximum number of problems that we can track at any time. Default value: 50. Valid range: 1 to 9999.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.SnapshotCollector.SnapshotCollectorConfiguration.AgentEndpoint
member.summary: The endpoint used to connect to the Application Insights Snapshot Debugger service. If null, the default endpoint is used. Default: null

member.name: P:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.SnapshotCollector.SnapshotCollectorConfiguration.ReconnectInterval
member.summary: How often we reconnect to the Snapshot Debugger endpoint. Default: 15 minutes. Range: 1 minute to 1 day.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.SnapshotCollector.SnapshotCollectorConfiguration.ProblemCounterResetInterval
member.summary: How often to reset the problem counters. When this interval is reached, all problem counts are reset to zero - meaning we need to see instances again before requesting new snapshots. Existing problems that have already reached the threshold for snapshotting, but haven't yet generated snapshots, remain active. Default value: 24 hours. Range: 1 minute to 7 days.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.SnapshotCollector.SnapshotCollectorConfiguration.SnapshotsPerTenMinutesLimit
member.summary: The maximum number of snapshots allowed in ten minutes. While there is no upper bound on this value, you should exercise caution increasing it on production workloads because it could impact the performance of your application. Creating a snapshot is very fast, but creating a minidump of the snapshot and uploading it to the Snapshot Debugger service is a much slower operation that will compete with your application for resources (both CPU and I/O). . The default value is 1.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.SnapshotCollector.SnapshotCollectorConfiguration.SnapshotsPerDayLimit
member.summary: The maximum number of snapshots allowed in one day (24 hours). Note that this limit is also enforced on the Application Insights service side. Uploads are rate limited to 50 per day per application (instrumentation key). This value helps prevent creating additional snapshots that will eventually be rejected during upload. A value of zero removes the limit entirely (not recommended). The default value is 30.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.SnapshotCollector.SnapshotCollectorConfiguration.SnapshotInLowPriorityThread
member.summary: Whether or not to process snapshots in a low IO priority thread. Creating a snapshot is a very fast operation but, in order to upload a snapshot to the Snapshot Debugger service, it must first be written to disk as a minidump. That happens in the SnapshotUploader process. Setting this value to true uses low prioirty IO to write the minidump which will not compete with your application for resources. Setting this value to false will speed up minidump creation at the expense of slowing down your application. The default value is true.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.SnapshotCollector.SnapshotCollectorConfiguration.ShadowCopyFolder
member.summary:
Specifies the folder to use for shadow copying binaries. If not set, the folders specified by the following environment variables are tried in order:
Fabric_Folder_App_Temp
LOCALAPPDATA
APPDATA
TEMP
Default value: null.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.SnapshotCollector.SnapshotCollectorConfiguration.TempFolder
member.summary: Specifies the folder to write minidumps and uploader log files. If not set, then %TEMP%\Dumps will be used. Default value: null.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.SnapshotCollector.SnapshotCollectorConfiguration.ProvideAnonymousTelemetry
member.summary: Send anonymous usage and error telemetry to Microsoft. This telemetry may be used if you contact Microsoft to help troubleshoot problems with the Snapshot Debugger. It is also used to monitor usage patterns. Default value: true.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.SnapshotCollector.SnapshotCollectorConfiguration.FailedRequestLimit
member.summary: The limit on the number of failed requests to request snapshots before the telemetry processor is disabled. Default value: 3.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.SnapshotCollector.SnapshotCollectorConfiguration.IsEnabledWhenProfiling
member.summary: Allow snapshot creation even if the Application Insights Profiler is collecting a detailed profiling session. Default value: true.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.SnapshotCollector.SnapshotCollectorConfiguration.IsLowPrioritySnapshotUploader
member.summary: Run the SnapshotUploader process at priority. Default value: true.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.SnapshotCollector.SnapshotCollectorConfiguration.UploaderProxy
member.summary: Override the proxy server used in the Snapshot Uploader process. You may need to use this if your application connects to the internet via a proxy server. The Snapshot Collector runs within your application's process and will use the same proxy settings. However, the Snapshot Uploader runs as a separate process and you may need to configure the proxy server manually. If this value is null, then Snapshot Collector will attempt to auto-detect the proxy's address by examining and passing on the value to the Snapshot Uploader. If this value is not null, then auto-detection is not used and the proxy server specified here will be used in the Snapshot Uploader. Default value: null.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.SnapshotCollector.SnapshotCollectorConfiguration.CaptureSnapshotMemoryWeight
member.summary: The weight given to the current process memory size when checking if there's enough memory to take a snapshot. The expected value is a greater than 0 proper fraction (0 < CaptureSnapshotMemoryWeight < 1). Default value: 0.5.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.SnapshotCollector.SnapshotCollectorConfiguration.ShareUploaderProcess
member.summary: If true only one instance of SnapshotUploader will collect and upload snapshots for multiple apps that share the InstrumentationKey. If set to false, the SnapshotUploader will be unique for each (ProcessName, InstrumentationKey) tuple. Default value: true

member.name: P:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.SnapshotCollector.SnapshotCollectorConfiguration.ExceptionSnappointSettingsFile
member.summary: Specifies json config file with exception snappoint settings Default value: null.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.SnapshotCollector.SnapshotCollectorConfiguration.HandleUntrackedExceptions
member.summary: Track exceptions that are not tracked by AI telemetry. Default value : true

member.name: P:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.SnapshotCollector.SnapshotCollectorConfiguration.IsExceptionSnappointsEnabled
member.summary: configuration flag to enable or disable filtering of exceptions, this is feature is disabled by default, set it to true to enable exception snappoints and specify configuration file Default value : false.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.SnapshotCollector.SnapshotCollectorConfiguration.DeoptimizeMethodCount
member.summary: Number of methods in the exception call stack we need to deoptimize. Methods are marked for deoptimization by walking down the stack from the faulting frame. Methods that are part of the Framework may be skipped unless it's the first method in the call stack. Set this value to 0 to disable deoptimization. Default value: 1.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.SnapshotCollector.SnapshotCollectorConfiguration.DeoptimizeIgnoredModules
member.summary: Comma separated list of modules for which all methods are ignored for deoptimization unless the faulting method is in the faulting frame. Default: null (Same as "mscorlib,System.Private.CoreLib" )

member.name: P:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.SnapshotCollector.SnapshotCollectorConfiguration.DeoptimizeIgnoredModulesSet
member.summary: Set of modules for which all methods are ignored for deoptimization unless the faulting method is in the faulting frame. Default: null

member.name: P:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.SnapshotCollector.SnapshotCollectorConfiguration.LogRotationInDays
member.summary: The number of days the uploader log files are persisted on disk. Set the value to 0 to keep the log files indefinitely. Default value: 30.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.SnapshotCollector.SnapshotCollectorConfiguration.IsInProcReJitEnabled
member.summary: Enables method deoptimization at runtime even if ProductionBreakpoints is missing. The value is used only when the application targets netcoreapp3.0 or newer. Default value : true.

member.name: T:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.SnapshotCollector.ConnectionString
member.summary: Represents the instrumentation key and endpoints for Application Insights features. The simplest ConnectionString defines the instrumentation key only. The instrumentation key may be a Structured iKey (see https://osgwiki.com/wiki/Structured_iKey) Optionally, the ConnectionString may also define endpoints for various features. These endpoints are specified by 'key=value' tokens. e.g. "MyFeatureEndpoint=https://example.com" defines the endpoint for "MyFeature". Finally, even if not explicitly specified, feature endpoints may be derived from an EndpointSuffix token. For example, the endpoint for a feature "NewFeature", if not explicitly defined via its own token, can be derived by prepending "https://newfeature." to the EndpointSuffix value.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.SnapshotCollector.ConnectionString.TryParse(System.String,Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.SnapshotCollector.ConnectionString@)
member.summary: Tries to parse the input as a ConnectionString. A valid input is a collection of tokens of the form "key=value", separated by semicolons. Keys may not be repeated and one of the keys must be "InstrumentationKey"
member.param: The input string that can be Structured Ikey or a Connection String
member.returns: True if parsed successfully else false

member.summary: Updates the instrumentation key on a connection string.
member.returns: The updated connection string.

member.summary: Update or add a feature endpoint to the ConnectionString.
member.param: The feature's endpoint. Must be an absolute URI.
member.returns: A new connection string with the modified endpoint.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.SnapshotCollector.ConnectionString.WithEndpointSuffix(System.String)
member.summary: Update or add the EndpointSuffix.
member.returns: connectionString with endpointSuffix value applied

member.name: M:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.SnapshotCollector.ConnectionString.GetFeatureEndpoint(System.String)
member.summary: Get the endpoint for a given feature. If the endpoint is not specified explicitly and an EndpointSuffix is specified, then the endpoint will be derived from the feature name and the EndpointSuffix. There is a special case for the "Ingestion" feature. If the Ingestion endpoint is not specified and there is an EndpointSuffix, then the generated endpoint will begin "https://dc." instead of "https://ingestion."
member.returns: Value of FeatureEndpoint. In the case of Ingestion, it is IngestionEndpoint=dc.endpointSuffix. If feature is not found, it returns Null

member.name: M:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.SnapshotCollector.EnvironmentUtilities.CreateSessionId
member.summary: Create a short, random session Id. The Id is a 9 byte (72bit) random number encoded with base64 giving a string of length 12. Compare that to Guid.NewGuid().ToString() which is length 36.

member.remarks: 9 bytes was chosen as being suitably random (very low probability of collision) and also to get the most efficiency out of Base64 encoding (every 3 bytes encodes to 4 chars).

member.name: M:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.SnapshotCollector.SingletonProcess.GetEncodedDiscriminatorName(System.String)
member.summary: Encode (hash) a user discriminator along with username and bitness in a short string that can be used to distinguish different running instances (where username and bitness are significant).
member.returns: A short, encoded string which is a hash of , the user name and the bitness.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.SnapshotCollector.SingletonProcess.GetMutexName(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Generate a name for the mutex that incorporates the application name and a discriminator.
member.param: A unique string to distinguish different clients of the application.
member.returns: The unique name.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.SnapshotCollector.SingletonProcess.TryAcquireSingleton(System.String,System.String,System.Threading.Mutex@)
member.summary: Try to acquire the singleton mutex for the given application.
member.param: A unique string to distinguish different clients of the application.
The mutex - either a new one or an existing one. If it's new, then the Mutex is owned.
member.returns: True if the Mutex is not already owned and this is the first instance. False if the Mutex is already owned.
member.remarks: The telemetry processor also checks this Mutex before launching a new instance.

member.summary: Detect if the application is running by testing for its singleton mutex.
member.returns: True if the mutex exists, indicating that the application is running.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.SnapshotCollector.StructuredInstrumentationKeyExtensions.TryParseInstrumentationKey(System.String,System.Guid@)
member.summary: Given a string, which might be a structured iKey, parse the GUID part. See https://osgwiki.com/wiki/Structured_iKey
member.returns: True if the instrumentation key has a valid GUID part.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.SnapshotCollector.StructuredInstrumentationKeyExtensions.TryParseStructuredInstrumentationKey(System.String,System.String@,System.String@)
member.summary: Given a string, which might be a structured iKey, extract the application ID part. A structured ikey has a domain id and an application id. The domain id is optional, but if it's not there, then the application id must be a GUID. Otherwise the domain ID part is 1 or 3 capital letters followed by a dash. The application ID is 1 to 36 characters from the set: [Aa-Zz0-9-] See https://osgwiki.com/wiki/Structured_iKey
member.param: If successful, the domain ID part. May be null if there is no domain id.
If successful, the application ID part.
member.returns: True if the given string is a valid structured instrumentation key.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.SnapshotCollector.StructuredInstrumentationKeyExtensions.IsValidDomainIdChar(System.Char)
member.summary: Can the given char be part of a domain ID. Capital letters only (A-Z).
member.returns: True if the character is acceptable.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.SnapshotCollector.StructuredInstrumentationKeyExtensions.IsValidApplicationIdChar(System.Char)
member.summary: Can the given char be part of an application ID. Alpha-numeric characters including a dash. [Aa-Zz0-9-]
member.returns: True if the character is acceptable.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Diagnostics.Utilities.DirectoryUtilities
member.summary: General purpose utilities dealing with archiveFile system directories.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Diagnostics.Utilities.DirectoryUtilities.Clean(System.String)
member.summary: Clean is sort of a 'safe' recursive delete of a directory. It either deletes the files or moves them to '*.deleting' names. It deletes directories that are completely empty. Thus it will do a recursive delete when that is possible. There will only be *.deleting files after this returns.
member.param: The name of the directory to clean.
member.returns: The number of files and directories that could not be deleted.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Diagnostics.Utilities.FileUtilities
member.summary: General purpose utilities dealing with archiveFile system files.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Diagnostics.Utilities.FileUtilities.ForceDelete(System.String)
member.summary: Delete works much like File.Delete, except that it will succeed if the archiveFile does not exist, and will rename the archiveFile so that even if the archiveFile is locked the original archiveFile variable will be made available. It renames the archiveFile with a '[num].deleting'. These files might be left behind.
member.param: The name of the file to delete.
member.returns: It returns true if it was completely successful. If there is a .deleting archiveFile left behind, it returns false.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Diagnostics.Utilities.FileUtilities.TryDelete(System.String)
member.summary: Try to delete 'fileName' catching any exception. It will also delete read-only files.
member.returns: True if successful.
